russian.text: Deprive a mirror of its silver and even the czar wonâ€™t see his face.
Whichever way you point a wagon tongue, that's the way it goes.
When it happens to you, you'll know it's true.
Make peace with men and quarrel with your faults.
The rich would have to eat money, but luckily the poor provide food.
Grief won't kill you, but it will knock you off your feet.
If there is no apple one eats a little carrot.
When the ass bears too light a load, he wants to lie down.
An old loan repaid is like finding something new.
To ask is no sin, and to be refused is no calamity.
Whoever runs with the wolf is no sheep.
Don't call a wolf to help you against the dogs.
The wolf will hire himself out very cheaply as a shepherd.
Bread is the best advice to the hungry.
A titmouse in the hand is better than a crane in the sky.
A toad too would like to crack nuts, but he has no teeth.
A virgin's heart is a dark forest.
A wife is not a pot, she will not break so easily.
A wife should be as humble as a lamb, busy as a bee, as beautiful as a bird of paradise and faithful as a turtle dove.
A wise companion is half the journey.
A wise man sees only water in the tears of a woman.
A wolf won't eat wolf.
A woman farmer had no trouble, so she bought a piglet.
A woman's tongue is longer than her hair.
A sparrow in the hand is better than a cock on the roof.
A spoken word is like a sparrow that once has flown away, cannot be caught again.
A spoken word is not a sparrow. Once it flies out, you can't catch it.
A spooked crow is afraid of a bush.
A spoonful of tar in a barrel of honey.
A stranger's soul is like a dark forest.
A tale is soon told; a deed is not soon done.
A thief's hat is burning.
A thousand friends are few; one enemy is too many.
A thread from everyone will make a shirt for the needy.
A wooden bed is better than a golden coffin.
A word of kindness is better than a bottle of vodka.
A young man should not marry yet, an old man not at all.
Absentmindedness is searching for the horse you are riding.
Abuse doesn't hang on the collar.
Accidents will happen in the best-regulated families.
Acknowledgement is half of correction.
Advertising is the driving force of business.
Afraid of the enemies - don't be a border guard.
After a storm comes fair weather, after sorrow comes joy.
A gowk at yule'll no be bright at beltane.
A guest has not to thank the host, but the host the guest.
A hammer breaks glass, but also forms steel. Everything cannot be hung on one nail.
A hammer will shatter glass yet it can forge steel.
A handful of dirt is pleasing if it's your own land.
A Horse has four legs, but still stumbles.
A judge and a stomach do their asking in silence.
A jug that has been mended lasts two hundred years.
A kind word is like a spring day.
A kopeck saves the rouble, and the rouble guards your head.
A cross-eyed Tsar, one-eyed ministers, blind subjects.
A day is long, but a lifetime is short.
A dog is wiser than a woman; it does not bark at its master.
A dog on the hay: will neither eat it himself, nor let others eat it.
A dog on the hay: will neither eat it himself, nor let others eat.
A drawing man clutches at straw.
A drop from every mug makes for a house for the barmaid.
A drop hollows out a stone.
A drop in the sea.
A drop of water in the eyes of the Tsar costs the country many handkerchiefs.
A priest's belly is made up of several sheepskins.
A proverb can't be judged.
A ruler without a nation is like a flower without the sun.
A sea will not dry up, a nation will not get lost.
A silent man is not a conquered man.
A sin of gold is followed by a punishment of lead.
A single Russian hair outweighs half a Pole.
A sleeping fox counts chicken in his dreams.
A smart person will not climb a mountain; A smart person will go around it.
A soldier on furlough lets his shirt hang out of his trousers.
A field held in common is always ravaged by bears.
A field in common is always ravaged by bears.
A fisherman can recognize another fisherman from afar.
A fly cannot enter a closed mouth.
A fly will not come into a closed mouth.
A fly will not get into a closed mouth.
A fool is not afraid to lose his mind.
A fool may throw into a well a stone which a hundred wise men cannot pull out.
A friendly word is like a spring day.
A girl never grows into a lady.
An empty mill will turn without the wind.
An enemy will agree, but a friend will argue.
An icon for the mind is like raw vodka for the stomach.
An ill-paying job is better than a lucrative heist.
An indispensable thing never has much value.
An old dog can't get used to chains.
An old friend is better than two new ones.
An old man telling lies is like a rich man stealing.
An uninvited guest is worse than the Mongol invasion.
An unsolicited guest is better than a solicited one.
An unsolicited guest is worse than a Tatar.
Any fish is good if it is on the hook.
Any sandpiper is great in his own swamp.
Around bread there will always be crumbs.
As busy as a bee.
As chicken is not a bird, woman is not a human being.
As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far place.
As hungry as a wolf.
As is well that ends well.
Don't blame your wife's side if your son is cross-eyed.
Don't boast when you start out, but when you get there.
Don't buy the house, buy the neighborhood.
Don't buy the house; buy the neighborhood.
Don't chat on the phone - a talker is a great find for a spy.
Don't dig a hole for someone else, as you will fall into it yourself.
Don't drive a Binya into the woods if he has found his way to your house.
Don't fight with the strong one, don't sue the rich one.
Don't hope for rain or thunder, hope for an agronomist.
Don't look a gift horse in the mouth.
Do not plant a tree with its root upward.
Do not play with fire - you will burn yourself.
Do not praise yourself when going of to battle going into battle; praise yourself coming out of battle.
Do not spit in the well - you may be thirsty by and by.
Do not spit into a wellï¿½it may be useful to drink water.
Do not spit into the well that you might need to drink out of.
Do not spit into the well you may have to drink of.
Do not teach a learned person.
Do not teach a pike to swim, a pike knows his own science.
Don't be so clever; cleverer ones than you are in jail.
Don't worry if you borrow, but worry if you lend.
Drowing man clutches at straw.
Each day learns from the one before it, but no day teaches the one after it.
Each time it is different.
Ears do not grow higher than the head.
Eat until you are half full; drink until you are half drunk.
Eat what is cooked, listen to what is said.
Eat what is cooked; listen to what is said.
Eggs cannot teach a hen.
Eggs don't teach the hens anything.
The naked don't fear robbery.
The newborn baby yells; you die in silence.
The night walks the same road as the dream.
The night's too short to warrant marrying poor.
The nights are short for him who married late in life.
The noblemen's quarrels can be read on the backs of the peasants.
The offender never forgives.
The old bear falls into the old trap.
The one who draws the cart is urged on.
The one who pulls a cart is urged on.
Take care of clothes since they are new, take care of your honor since you are young.
Take care of your dress from when it's new and your honor from your youth.
Take the bull by the horns.
Take the goods the gods provide.
Take thy thoughts to bed with thee, for the morning is wiser than the evening.
Take time to smell the roses.
Take time when time is, for time will away.
Take together, it will not be heavy.
Tastes are not argued.
Tears come more often from the eyes than from the heart.
The past is for God, the future for the Tsars.
The payment adorns the debt.
The peasant sweats and the nobleman is always right.
The peasant will not cross himself before it begins to thunder.
The person afraid of bad luck will never know good.
The poorer, the more generous.
The reserve doesn't weight your pocket.
The rich would have to eat money if the poor did not provide food.
The riches that are in the heart cannot be stolen.
The river is flat but the banks are steep.
Clemency is the support of justice.
Clever father, clever daughter; clever mother, clever son.
Close to the Tsar, close to death.
Confide a secret to a dumb man and he will speak.
Conversation shortens the distance, singing lightens the load.
Cows forget that they were calves.
Creditors have better memories than debtors.
Crows are black the world over.
Cry and the whole world cries with you.
Cry not for the hair when the head is off.
A liar can go round the world but cannot come back.
A little spark kindles a great fire.
A lizard on a cushion will still seek leaves.
A lonely person is at home everywhere.
A long pull and a strong pull and a pull altogether.
A lucky man can stumble upon a treasure while an unlucky one can't even find a mushroom.
A man is judged by his deeds, not by his words.
A man should not be struck when he is down.
A man without a wife is like a man in winter without a fur cap.
A mile walk with a friend has only one hundred steps.
A glass for the vodka, for the beer a mug, and for the table, cheerful company.
A golden handshake convinces even the most skeptical judge.
A good borrower is a lazy payer.
A good citizen owes his life to his country.
A good laugh is sunshine in a house.
A good man maybe, but it's best to shoot him.
A good merchant has neither money nor goods.
A good wife and a wholesome cabbage soup, what more could you want?
A good-looking man is pleasant to look at, but it is easier to live with an amusing one.
A goose doesn't befriend a pig.
Best is the enemy of good.
Better a bed of wood than a bier of gold.
Better a dove on the plate than a woodgrouse in the mating place.
Better a fair pair of heels than a halter.
Better late than never.
Better to stumble than make a slip of the tongue.
Better to turn back than to lose your way.
Better too aware than too unaware.
Between hammer and anvil.
Beware of a quiet dog and still water.
A mile walked with a friend has only one hundred steps.
A net will catch more than a pole.
A new broom sweeps in a new way.
A nightingale doesn't feed on songs.
A Party member is an active person.
A person never gets tired working for himself.
A pessimist is a well-informed optimist.
A pig in a parlor is still a pig.
A pig will find mud.
A priest's beard is always soaked in butter.
Beware of a quite dog and still water.
Big voyage for a big ship.
Both cheap and angry.
Bread and salt never quarrel.
Bury truth in a golden coffin, it will break it open.
Call a pot, just don't put into the oven.
Cat died of curiosity.
Chickens are counted in autumn.
Chipped china lasts two centuries.
Choose a matchmaker, not a bride.
Debt is beautiful after repaid.
Debt is beautiful only after it is repaid.
Deprive a mirror of its silver and even the czar won't see his face.
Desert and reward seldom keep company.
Desire is worse then compulsion.
Devils live in beautiful mansions.
Devils live in quiet pond.
Dividing the pelt of a bear not yet killed.
Do not be born good or handsome, but be born lucky.
Do not carry rubbish out of your hut.
All lay loads on a willing horse.
All roads lead to moscow.
All roads lead to Rome.
All the cones drop on poor makar.
An agreement is more valuable than money.
An argument is fine only when there is to be a fight.
An axe does not cut down a tree by itself.
An egg is dear on Easter day.
An empty barrel makes the greatest sound.
An empty barrel rattles louder.
Asking is no sin, and being refused is no tragedy.
Bad luck is fertile.
Badly oiled wheels will squeak.
Be patient, cossack, and you'll be a chieftain.
Be wise, but pretend to be ignorant.
Beat your own and others will fear you.
Beauty is the sister of idleness and the mother of luxury.
Beauty's sister is vanity, and its daughter lust.
Before we went to churches and bars - now we go to clubs and cinemas.
Berry by berry, a basket will be full.
Cry not out before you are hurt.
Curious Varvara's nose was torn off.
Custom is stronger than law.
Cut down the tree that you are able to.
Death answers before it is asked.
Death carries on its shoulders a heavy Tsar just as easily as a light beggar.
Death does not come free of charge, for it costs us our life.
Death does not take the old but the ripe.
Death is a giant against whom even the Tsars must draw weapons.
Death is not found behind mountains but right behind our shoulders.
As long as a child does not cry, it does not matter what pleases it.
As long as the fish swims in the water, don't light up the grill.
As long as the sun shines one does not ask for the moon.
As soon as your cart is turned over, everyone rushes to give you advice.
As twice two is four.
As you brew, so must you drink.
As you cooked the porridge, so must you eat it.
As you make your bed, so you will sleep.
Ask a lot, but take what is offered.
Ask a silly question and you get a silly answer.
There was ï¿½ there wasn't.
There was a time they loved an accordionist, and now the time has come where they love a tractor driver.
There were people before us and there will be people after us.
There will be trouble if the cobbler starts making pies.
There will come a time when the seed will sprout.
There would be no good fortune had misfortune not helped.
There's no bad without the good.
There's no harm in wine, it's drunkenness that is at fault.
There's no harm in wine; it's drunkenness that is at fault.
They bow to you when borrowing, you bow to them when collecting.
"Your feet are crooked, your hair is good for nothing," said the pig to the horse.
'Tis a hard winter when one wolf eats another.
A bachelor is never sent as a go-between.
A bad dancer always has trouble with his balls.
A bad peace is better than a good quarrel.
A bad rumour flies on wings.
A beaten one is worth two unbeaten ones.
A bird may be known by its flight.
A boat stands firmer with two anchors.
A cat always knows whose meat it eats.
You do not swap horses while crossing the ford.
You don't get a headache from what other people have drunk.
You don't get something for nothing.
You don't learn anything from buying, but you do from selling.
You don't milk a cow with your hands in your pockets.
You get to really know your friend when trouble comes.
You get used to everything -- even hell.
You have summer and you have winter -- why, then, be in a hurry?
You heard the ring, but don't know where.
You know a bird from the way he flies.
After a storm fair weather, after sorrow joy.
After all, every man is the son of a woman.
After the head is off, one does not cry over the hair.
After your daughter is married, there comes a number of potential sons-in-law.
All ages are submissive to love.
All are not cooks that walk with long knives.
All are not cooks who walk with long knives.
All cats are grey at night.
All is not gold that glitters.
All is well that ends well.
Every cricket must know its hearth.
Every day is a messenger of God.
Every peasant is proud of the pond in his village because from it he measures the sea.
Every road has two directions.
Every sandpiper praises his own swamp.
Every sandpiper praises its own swamp.
Every seed knows its time.
Every vegetable has its time.
Everyone loves the tree that gives him shelter.
Everything is funny as long as it happens to someone else.
If you go to war pray once; if you go on a sea journey pray twice; but pray three times when you are going to be married.
If you have eaten the morsel on Wednesday, do not look for it on Thursday.
If you learn a lot, you'll age soon.
If you make a fool to pray to God, he will hurt forehead.
If you rely on god, you won't fail.
If you rush things, you'll just make others laugh.
If you start chasing two hares, you will catch none.
If you take it together, it will not be heavy.
If you talk to an official you must talk rubles.
If you throw nettles into your neighbors garden you will find them growing in your own.
If age and experience came at birth, We would have neither youth nor mirth.
If everyone gives one thread, the poor man will have a shirt.
If everyone were a gentleman, who would make the mills work?

If God sends you meal, the devil takes the sack.
If Jesus Christ comes to help me, I laugh at the angels.
If men could foresee the future, they would still behave as they do now.
If Moscow is the heart of Russia and St. Petersburg is its head, then Kiev is its mother.
If mushrooms grew in the mouth, that would be not mouth but kitchen garden.
If not by washing, then by rolling.
It is good to pay with other people's money.
It is never winter in the land of hope.
It is not the horse that draws the cart, but the oats.
It is unpleasant to go alone, even to be drowned.
It is wanted and repellent.
It makes chicken laugh.
It takes all kinds of trees to make a forest.
It was smooth on paper, but forgotten about ravines.
It was smooth on paper, but we've forgotten about ravines.
It will heal well before your wedding.
Either chest in crosses, or a head in bushes.
Elder-berry is in the kitchen-garden, therefore your Uncle is in Kiev.
Elderberries in the yard and an uncle in kiev.
Envy can breed swans from bad duck eggs.
Envy sees the sea but not the rocks.
Eternal peace lasts only until the next war.
Eternal peace lasts until the next war.
Eternity makes room for a salty cucumber.
Even a blind pig finds an acorn every once in awhile.
Even a blind squirrel finds an acorn sometimes.
From fire to flame.
Further from the eye - closer to the heart.
Give a naked man a piece of cloth and he will say it is too thick.
Give your children too much freedom and you lose your own.
Giving gifts to the rich is like pouring water into the sea.
Glory lies still; abuse is running.
Glowing coals sparkle oft.
God bestows no horns upon an ill-tempered cow.
God comes with leaden feet but strikes with iron hands.
God does not give horns to a cow that likes to gore.
Everything tastes bitter to him with gall in his mouth.
Eyes are afraid, but hands are doing the job.
Fear has big eyes.
Fear has large eyes.
Fear the goat from the front, the horse from the rear, and a man from all sides.
Fear the Greeks bearing gifts.
Fear the law not the judge.
Fedot, yet not the one.
Fedot, yet not the right one.
Feel free to jabber, Emelya ï¿½ it's your week.
Intoxication is not the wine's fault but man's.
Invite a peasant to your table and he'll put his feet on it.
It is a bad workman that has a bad saw.
It is bread that keeps one warm, not fur.
It is easier for the horse when a woman gets off the cart.
It is easier to bear a child once a year than to shave every day.
It is easier to fill bellies than one pair of the eyes.
It is easier to fill twenty bellies than one pair of eyes.
It is easy to undress the naked.
It is good to be visiting, but it is better at home.
However muchwould the string wind, the end will be reached anyway.
However would the string wind, the end will be reached.
However you feed the wolf, he still looks at the wood.
Hunger is not your aunt.
Hypocrites kick with their hind feet while licking with their tongues.
I need not fear my enemies because the most they can do is attack me. I need not fear my friends because the most they can do is betray me. But I have much to fear from people who are indifferent.
I sell it for what I bought it.
Ice in spring is treacherous; new friendships are seldom sure.
Idleness is the mother of all vices.
If a poor man finds a penny, it is probably a false one.
The stargazer's toe is often stubbed.
The sun will shine into our yard too.
The sythe ran into a stone.
The tallest blade of grass is the first to be cut by the scythe.
The tallest tree is rooted in the ground.
The tears of strangers are only water.
The teeth are not match for the nut.
The thief has a chicken's heart -- he sleeps in fear.
The thief makes perhaps one mistake; those he stole from made a hundred.
The toe of the star-gazer is often stubbed.
Don't look for a sea when you can drown in a puddle.
Don't pluck the apple while it is green; when it is ripe it will fall of itself.
Don't praise your furnace when the house is cold.
Don't put all eggs in one basket.
Don't put all your eggs in one basket.
Don't put it in my ear, but in my hand.
Don't put new wine into old bottles.
Don't raise your stick and the dog won't bark at you.
Don't swear off of beggary and jail.
Don't wake up trouble while it sleeps quietly.
He lived a colonel but died a corpse.
He makes the bed soft, yet it's hard to sleep on.
He need not search his pockets for words.
He that would learn to pray, let him go to sea.
He took the devil's mat, but he'll pay back with his skin.
He who doesn't risk never gets to drink champagne.
He who is destined for the gallows will not be drowned.
He who is frightened of a sparrow will never sow barley.
He who offers his back should not complain if it is beaten.
He who serves the Tsar cannot serve his people.
Even an eagle will not fly higher than the sun.
Even an old lady makes mistakes.
Even good dogs have fleas.
Even honor is not an honor, if there is nothing to eat.
Even in the ashes there will be a few sparks.
Even one person in the field is a warrior, if he is a soviet warrior.
Even pulling a fish out of the pond requires some effort.
Even vinegar is sweet when for freebie.
Even walls may have ears.
Every ananya has his melania.
Do not cut the bough you are sitting on.
Do not dig a hole for somebody else; you yourself will fall into it.
Do not look at gift horse's mouth.
Do not look at gift hourse's mouth.
Do not look for further good from good.
Do not look for good from good.
Do not make an elephant out of a fly.
Do not make jokes that cost more than a ruble.
Do not make me kiss, and you will not make me sin.
Do not measure others by your own yardstick.
It will last out our time; if after us no grass grows, what does it matter to us?
It will snap where it's the thinnest.
It's a crime if you get caught.
It's better to be a cripple than always sitting down.
It's better to be known as a rascal than a fool.
It's better to be too aware than too unaware.
It's better to see once than hear a hundred times.
It's easier to tear a hole than to mend one.
It's nice to have a spoon in time for dinner.
It's the still waters that are inhibited by devils.
Nobody goes to another monastery with one's own charter.
Nobody goes to Tula with one's own samovar.
Nosy Barbara's nose was torn off at the market.
Not all who make love make marriages.
Not every glittering thing is gold.
Not everyone who has a cowl on is a monk.
Not everything is a mermaid that dives into the water.
Not for village, not for town.
Nothing is worse than waiting or chasing.
Old age is not a blessing.
If the thunder is not loud, the peasant forgets to cross himself.
If there is no caviar one eats porridge.
If you are a host to your guest, be a host to his dog as well.
If you are afraid of the wolves, do not go to the woods.
If you are going to do something carelessly, it is better to give it up entirely.
If you called yourself a milk-mushroom ï¿½ get into the basket!.
If you chase two rabbits, you will not catch either one.
If you didn't catch anything when fishing, then a crab is a fish.
If you do not strike back at him who hits you, there is no way for him to find out whether you also have hands.
If you want to be a hundred you must start young.
If you were born lucky, even your rooster will lay eggs.
If you will not hear reason, she will surely rap your knuckles.
If you're afraid of wolves, don't go to the woods.
If your face looks skewed, don't blame the mirror.
If your face skewed, don't blame the mirror.
If your heart is a rose, then your mouth will speak perfumed words.
In a crush, yet without resentment.
In a deal there are two fools: the one who asks too much and the one who asks too little.
In a fight the rich man tries to save his face, the poor man his coat.
God does not give to the cow that butts.
God doesn't give more beards than soap.
God gave, God took back.
God gives to those who get up early.
God gives to those who wake up early.
God is always where we don't look for him.
God is far up high, the Tsar is far away.
God keeps those safe who keep themselves safe.
God marks the crook.
God takes care of the one who takes care of himself.
For every one with a plow ï¿½ there're seven with a spoon.
For him who does not believe in signs, there is no way to live in the world.
For ill do well, Then fear not hell.
For some people war is war, for others - dear mother.
Force a fool to pray and he'll crack his forehead.
Forgiveness is a pillar of justice.
Fortune and misfortune live in the same courtyard.
Freedom for the free and heaven for the saved.
Friendship is friendship, but keep our tobacco apart.
Friendship is one thing and tobacco is another.
Fighting for your country glorifies death.
First do it, then say it.
First the stable, then the cow.
Fishermen recognize each other from far away.
Fools make feasts and wise men eat them.
For a drunkard the sea only reaches his knees.
For a drunken one a sea is knee-deep, and a puddle - ears-deep.
For a mad dog, seven versts is not a long detour.
For a poor man, to prepare for a trip means belt himself.
For each wise man there are plenty of fools.
Hang a German, even if he is a good man.
Happiness is not a horse, you cannot harness it.
Happiness is not a horse; you cannot harness it.
Haste is good only for catching flies.
Have a good time if you want -- but don't overdo it.
Having a good wife and rich cabbage soup, seek not other things.
Having given your word, be strong; not having done it, try not to promise.
He can cheat a fish of its skin.
He is dead who is faultless.
He lied like an eyewitness.
The casket opened simple.
The castle gates will always open for gold-laden donkeys.
The cat knows who's meat it has eaten.
The cat with cream on her whiskers should have a good excuse ready.
The church is near but the road is icy; the bar is far away but I'll walk carefully.
The coat is quite new, only the holes are old.
The crow flew over the sea but returned still a crow.
The cub does not teach the Wolf.
The devil is not as scary as they paint him.
The devil is not so frighful as he is painted.
If one hand were the other they would both want to be clean.
If rubles fell from heaven the poor would have no bag.
If the child does not cry, the mother won't know what it wants.
If the collective farm is wealthy, the farmer is happy.
If the devil catch a man idle he'll set him at work.

If the pocket is empty, the judge is deaf.

Golden hands, but a wicked mouth.
Good brotherhood is the best wealth.
Good fortune wears a pretty dress but its underclothes do not bear investigation.
Gossip needs no carriage.
Guard your honor from your youth, and your weapons once you've got them in hand.
Habit is a second nature.
Habit is a shirt that we wear till death.
Hands wash each other.
Pray for revenge, and God will turn a deaf ear.
Pray to God but continue to row to the shore.
Pray to God, but be level-headed.
Pray to God, but keep on rowing to the shore.
Pray to God, but keep rowing to the shore.
Praying kneads no dough.
Proverbs are the people's wisdom.
Pull out the beak and the tail gets stuck, pull out the tail and the beak gets stuck.
Rain falls alike on the just and the unjust.
Rather a bitter truth than a sweet lie.
In a quarrel, leave room for reconciliation.
In a rickety stable the cow produces no milk.
In affect you can break even an elm.
In other persons' eye one can see a mote, in one's own - cannot see a log.
In Russia every day is of thirty hours.
In the garden of time grows the flower of consolation.
In the kingdom of hope, there is no winter.
In the lake of lies there are many dead fish.
In the land of hope, there is never any winter.
In the times of czar Goroch.
He would exclaim "Ah" looking at himself.
Heart with pepper, soul with garlic.
His word is as good as a tied knot.
